name: Hyperlydian
description: The brightest valid heptatonic scale in 31-EDO, with maximally wide intervals while maintaining a minimum interval of 2 steps.

name: MacroBi Neutral Open Ionian
description: 1th mode of Hyperlydian. A neutral, open mode derived from Hyperlydian.

name: MacroBi Neutral Open Ionian 2
description: 2th mode of Hyperlydian. A neutral, open mode derived from Hyperlydian.

name: MacroBi Neutral Open Dorian
description: 3th mode of Hyperlydian. A neutral, open mode derived from Hyperlydian.

name: MacroBi Neutral Open Ionian 3
description: 4th mode of Hyperlydian. A neutral, open mode derived from Hyperlydian.

name: MacroBi Neutral Open Ionian 4
description: 5th mode of Hyperlydian. A neutral, open mode derived from Hyperlydian.

name: MacroBi Neutral Open Dorian 2
description: 6th mode of Hyperlydian. A neutral, open mode derived from Hyperlydian.

name: MacroBi Lydian
description: Derived from hyperlydian by lowering the 4th degree by 1 step. Contains multiple whole-tone intervals. All intervals are at least 2 steps to avoid chromatic tension.

name: MacroBi Neutral Open Ionian 5
description: 1th mode of MacroBi Lydian. A neutral, open mode derived from MacroBi Lydian.

name: MacroBi Neutral Open Dorian 3
description: 2th mode of MacroBi Lydian. A neutral, open mode derived from MacroBi Lydian.

name: MacroBi Neutral Open Phrygian
description: 3th mode of MacroBi Lydian. A neutral, open mode derived from MacroBi Lydian.

name: MacroBi Neutral Open Mixolydian
description: 4th mode of MacroBi Lydian. A neutral, open mode derived from MacroBi Lydian.

name: MacroBi Neutral Open Ionian 6
description: 5th mode of MacroBi Lydian. A neutral, open mode derived from MacroBi Lydian.

name: MacroBi Neutral Open Dorian 4
description: 6th mode of MacroBi Lydian. A neutral, open mode derived from MacroBi Lydian.

name: PolyMacro Lydian (4th↓2)
description: Derived from hyperlydian by flattening the 4th degree by 2 steps. Results in a scale with highly varied intervals. Contains multiple whole-tone intervals. All intervals are at least 2 steps to avoid chromatic tension.

name: PolyMacro Neutral Open Ionian
description: 1th mode of PolyMacro Lydian (4th↓2). A neutral, open mode derived from PolyMacro Lydian (4th↓2).

name: PolyMacro Neutral Open Dorian
description: 2th mode of PolyMacro Lydian (4th↓2). A neutral, open mode derived from PolyMacro Lydian (4th↓2).

name: PolyMacro Neutral Open Phrygian
description: 3th mode of PolyMacro Lydian (4th↓2). A neutral, open mode derived from PolyMacro Lydian (4th↓2).

name: PolyMacro Neutral Open Mixolydian
description: 4th mode of PolyMacro Lydian (4th↓2). A neutral, open mode derived from PolyMacro Lydian (4th↓2).

name: PolyMacro Neutral Open Ionian 2
description: 5th mode of PolyMacro Lydian (4th↓2). A neutral, open mode derived from PolyMacro Lydian (4th↓2).

name: PolyMacro Neutral Open Dorian 2
description: 6th mode of PolyMacro Lydian (4th↓2). A neutral, open mode derived from PolyMacro Lydian (4th↓2).

name: MicroMacro Lydian (4th↓2)
description: Derived from hyperlydian by diminishing the 4th degree by 3 steps. Contains multiple whole-tone intervals. All intervals are at least 2 steps to avoid chromatic tension.

name: MicroMacro Neutral Open Ionian
description: 1th mode of MicroMacro Lydian (4th↓2). A neutral, open mode derived from MicroMacro Lydian (4th↓2).

description: 5th mode of MicroMacro Lydian (4th↓2). A neutral, open mode derived from MicroMacro Lydian (4th↓2).

name: MicroMacro Neutral Open Dorian 2
description: 6th mode of MicroMacro Lydian (4th↓2). A neutral, open mode derived from MicroMacro Lydian (4th↓2).

name: MicroMacro Lydian (4th↓2) 2
description: Derived from hyperlydian by lowering the 2nd degree by 1 step and diminishing the 4th degree by 3 steps. Contains multiple whole-tone intervals. All intervals are at least 2 steps to avoid chromatic tension.

name: PolyMicro Lydian (2nd↓2)
description: Derived from hyperlydian by diminishing the 2nd degree by 3 steps and diminishing the 4th degree by 3 steps. Results in a scale with highly varied intervals. Contains multiple whole-tone intervals. All intervals are at least 2 steps to avoid chromatic tension.

name: SeptalMicro Lydian (2nd↓2)
description: Derived from hyperlydian by severely diminishing the 2nd degree by 4 steps and diminishing the 4th degree by 3 steps. Contains multiple whole-tone intervals. All intervals are at least 2 steps to avoid chromatic tension.
